results.title: [PyCDE] ConcatOp of arrays causes crash
results.notes: Similar crash in Type::cast for IntegerType, but in CombOps context (ConcatOp), not hw::ConstantOp. PyCDE vs Arc dialect.

results.title: [HW] Unequal equal types on instancing a module outputting a parametrized array
results.notes: ArrayType parameter type mismatch (i32 vs i64), but not a crash. Different root cause - parameter attribute type mismatch, not enable transformation.

results.title: [Arc] Support hw.wires of aggregate types
results.notes: Arc dialect aggregate type issue, but for struct not array. Related to arc.tap validation, not state property inference.

results.title: [MooreToCore] Support for Unsized Array Type
results.notes: Array type support in Moore dialect, unrelated to Arc or type casting issues.

results.title: [LLHD][Arc] Indexing and slicing lowering from Verilog to LLVM IR
results.notes: Arc dialect array indexing/slicing, different subsystem from state property inference.

top_match.title: [HW] Unequal equal types on instancing a module outputting a parametrized array
top_match.reason: Highest similarity - both involve array types and type casting/validation issues. However, different root causes.

reasoning:
This is a NEW BUG REPORT. While several issues involve arrays and type operations, none match the specific crash pattern:

1. Issue #6271 (score 7.5): ArrayType type mismatch, but NOT a crash. Different subsystem (instance parameter attribute, not state property inference).
2. Issue #3289 (score 6.5): Type::cast assertion crash, but in CombOps.ConcatOp, not in hw::ConstantOp. Different dialect (PyCDE/Comb vs Arc).
3. Issue #6373 (score 4.0): Arc aggregate types, but for struct validation, not state property transformation.

Key differences from the crash report:
- Root cause: applyEnableTransformation attempting hw::ConstantOp::create with ArrayType (not IntegerType)
- Component: Arc/InferStatePropertiesPass, not other dialects
- Trigger: Array-typed state variables in always_ff blocks with enable patterns
- Stack trace: InferStateProperties.cpp:211 specific assertion

This crash has NOT been reported before in these exact circumstances.
